bibl.title: Alexandrian Influences on the Architecture and Decoration of the Hellenistic Tombs on Cyprus.
bibl.note: The fact that such tombs are not restricted to Nea Paphos but are found in the wider region of the capital and even as far as Phlamoudi on the north of the island leads to think that some of the tombs belong to well-to-do Cypriots who tried to emulate the style and the trends of Alexandria.

bibl.title: Proceedings of the International Conference 'Egypt and Cyprus in Antiquity' (Nicosia, 3-6 April 2003)

bibl.seg: Michaelides Demetrios and Anne-Marie Guimier-Sorbets, Alexandrian Influences on the Architecture and Decoration of the Hellenistic Tombs on Cyprus.

D. Michaelides, Vasiliki Kassianidou and Robert S. Merrillees (Edd.), Proceedings of the International Conference 'Egypt and Cyprus in Antiquity' (Nicosia, 3-6 April 2003) (Oxford, 2009) pp. 216-241, 42 figg.

The fact that such tombs are not restricted to Nea Paphos but are found in the wider region of the capital and even as far as Phlamoudi on the north of the island leads to think that some of the tombs belong to well-to-do Cypriots who tried to emulate the style and the trends of Alexandria.
